title: Elementary – Cycle 1 – Progression of Learning - Mathematics (2009)
subject: Mathematics, Science and Technology

9A49BBEFB854445BA839DFE2E329F774.description: Formulates questions for a survey (based on age-appropriate topics, students’ language level, etc.)

8084CA5E91CA4F5C91F0346AE011CC49.description: Estimates and measures temperature using conventional units; Vocabulary: Degree Celsius Symbol °C

3C80FA83B4894AB0843413D669EF28D4.description: Establishes relationships between units of measure; Vocabulary: Day, hour, minute, second; Symbols h, min, s, representation of time: 3 h, 3 h 25 min, 03:25, 3:25 a.m., Daily cycle, weekly cycle, yearly cycle

9C67094CBF8D49CBB3E79142B80DA94E.description: Estimates and measures time using conventional units

06BB85846D68426DB12B94B8F94D2E7D.description: Calculates the perimeter of plane figures; Vocabulary- Width, length, height, depth, Unit of measure, centimetre, decimetre, metre, Symbols- m, dm, cm

2AD20CB243184A92A0113D632A073F48.description: Estimates and measures the dimensions of an object using unconventional units

D3A6DCE25F2E49358173CA0F0AF6D227.description: Describes plane figures (square, rectangle, triangle and rhombus); Vocabulary- Straight line, closed straight line, curved line, Plane figure, side, Square, circle, rectangle, triangle, rhombus

5123F550EE1B4F47959D06FA543732BD.description: Compares and constructs figures made with closed curved lines or closed straight lines

24CE65A53CF8463DA0C599306CA6EE7E.description: Identifies the main solids (e.g. spheres, cones, cubes, cylinders, prisms, pyramids); Vocabulary Solid, base of a solid, face, flat surface, curved surface Sphere, cone, cube, cylinder, prism, pyramid

614F83726C92444C8A1A328E2C76FFCD.description: Compares objects or parts of objects in the environment with solids (e.g. spheres, cones, cubes, cylinders, prisms, pyramids)

197A4505870B477EB48B7158EC43AAFD.description: becomes familiar with its basic functions (+, –, =, 0 to 9 number keys, all clear, clear)

443764E6ADEE46098CDA4D6B3CEFB6CA.description: Determines the missing term in an equation (relationships between operations): a + b = ?, a + ? = c, ? + b = c, a – b = ?, a – ? = c, ? – b = c

7204B549EA5943E18A7DC533C18E5BEC.description: Develops processes for written computation (addition and subtraction)

16771E754A5247AD96AEA7BA14D5F93A.description: Uses his/her own processes to determine the sum or difference of two natural numbers

9E093E8D8B2541169BD4ED4956CA4EE4.description: Masters all addition facts (0 + 0 to 10 + 10) and the corresponding subtraction facts

99974B36236D4550BABBBDF4BA6B46F6.description: Develops various strategies that promote mastery of number facts and relates them to the properties of addition

976B8A19864E4EDE9C28F298078FF43C.description: Builds a memory of addition facts2 (0 + 0 to 10 + 10) and the corresponding subtraction facts, using objects, drawings, charts or tables

5543ED8D16FA46D49175A83F343102AF.description: Builds a repertoire of memorized addition and subtraction facts1

048FFE25846D4FA39243984E2B347DDB.description: an addition or subtraction involving natural numbers

2DCD3EC5F7BB4DCBA0D12C65672EF9D4.description: Natural numbers (based on the benchmarks for each cycle)

A999831BF67B426EAFA12BDDD61C9565.description: operations (addition and subtraction) and the commutative property of addition: Vocabulary- Plus, minus, less, more, Addition, subtraction, sum, difference

8D70BE4660CA47E0A8796E553843044C.description: Determines numerical equivalencies using relationships between

82EA39EB0ED147D9A43C92981D31AFA6.description: Establishes equality relations between numerical expressions (e.g. 3 + 2 = 6 – 1)

6B92CD49A9614CA2999E7B6CE651AE8C.description: rectangular arrays, repeated addition, Cartesian product, sharing, and number of times x goes into y (using objects and diagrams)

0FDB7A9E894C4128A696A82869E420C8.description: Uses objects, diagrams or equations to represent a situation and conversely, describes a situation represented by objects, diagrams or equations (use of different meanings of multiplication and division)

933E7A611B3C4BA08778C0DB9F1D3AF3.description: Uses objects, diagrams or equations to represent a situation and conversely, describes a situation represented by objects, diagrams or equations (use of different meanings of addition and subtraction)

7F602B95D3434EFDB22BD3AC2FB08A58.description: Determines the operation(s) to perform in a given situation

3335B0AE891B45F4BCE0B483480A7A32.description: Arithmetic: Meaning of operations involving numbers

4F5F1B9F953542789C992AC53FBA32FE.description: Locates fractions on a number line: Vocabulary - Fraction, half, one third, one quarter

E7795B18685C4A7D8D67D8AB1679A673.description: Represents a fraction in a variety of ways, based on a whole or a collection of objects

7B863C42E74C47F89872F66105FC3A1A.description: Identifies fractions related to everyday items (using objects or drawings)

C817B431F06E4F43B50730572BEF072C.description: Represents the power of a natural number: Vocabulary - Grouping, digit, number, unit, tens place, hundreds place, Natural number, even number, odd number, is equal to, is bigger than (is greater than); is smaller than (is less than), Increasing order, decreasing order, Number line, Symbols, 0 to 9, <, >, =, numbers written using digits

C394B2391F2A4ECF9C1BCF16CE00201E.description: Approximates a collection, using objects or drawings (e.g. estimate, round up/down to a given value)

33DF7C41FAC847948B879D66E0B7E3A0.description: Classifies natural numbers in various ways, based on their properties (e.g. even numbers, composite numbers)

964EFB04DC104D95996141A662AD6FDA.description: Locates natural numbers using different visual aids (e.g. hundreds chart, number strip, number line)

8765FD299D0D463AB0F86419830E1C8D.description: Describes number patterns, using his/her own words and appropriate mathematical vocabulary (e.g. even numbers, odd numbers, square numbers, triangular numbers, prime numbers, composite numbers)

A64C5CB43A554577826CF4E6258F8BB4.description: Arranges natural numbers in increasing or decreasing order

E2BA40DF0ACB4F8393D0B7E207956300.description: Composes and decomposes a natural number in a variety of ways (e.g. 123 = 100 + 23, 123 = 100 + 20 + 3, 123 = 50 + 50 + 20 + 3, 123 = 2 × 50 + 30 ? 7,  123 = 2 × 60 + 3)

06D4BDD429FF4F12B122CB6CE462D3C5.description: emphasis on place value in non-apparent, non-accessible groupings, using materials for which groupings are symbolic (e.g. abacus, money)

E656A737AFCF49E1A74FE21B0FBF02A8.description: emphasis on exchanging apparent, non-accessible groupings, using structured materials (e.g. base ten blocks, number tables)

7713235D78794047A8C130B6FD78F74F.description: emphasis on apparent, accessible groupings using objects, drawings or unstructured materials (e.g. tokens, nesting cubes, groups of ten objects placed inside a bag and ten of these bags placed inside another container)

402A6CB658D946DD875EE3A7A9BFA8F4.description: Represents natural numbers in different ways or associates a number with a set of objects or drawings

B426292BEDC3490FAE00AC4F801301D3.description: Reads and writes any natural number

5BF73DDD2A88411EB256A1D41EC14F0B.description: counts a collection by grouping or regrouping

AADF66CC2F034E0B937017509CFDF738.description: matches the gesture to the corresponding number word; recognizes the cardinal aspect of a number and the conservation of number in various combinations

C40581B2802A40E2BF8A3516D01FE597.description: counts forward from a given number

32ABA23F432E46169A425D49FF28A9A6.description: Counts or recites counting rhymes involving natural numbers
